title: Problem 2
content:
(20 points)

Here are the singular, dual, and plural forms of some Kiowa nouns and their English translations. Not all forms are given, although all exist.

| Singular        | Dual            | Plural            | Translation         |
|-----------------|-----------------|-------------------|---------------------|
| adↄ             | a               | a                 | tree                |
| matʰↄnsjan      | matʰↄnsjan      | matʰↄnsjadↄ       | little girl         |
| k’ↄ             | k’ↄ             | k’ↄgↄ             | knife               |
| tʰot’olagↄ      | tʰot’ola        | tʰot’olagↄ        | orange              |
| aufi            | -          | aufigↄ                  | fish                |
| pʰjaboadↄ       |  -       | pʰjaboa                  | street lamp         |
| matʰↄn          |   -      | matʰↄdↄ                  | girl                |
| k’ↄnbohodↄ      |  -   | k’ↄnbohon                    | hat                 |
| t’ↄ             | -         | t’ↄgↄ                   | spoon               |
| -               | -         | e                 | bread               |
| alↄsↄhjegↄ      | -               | alↄsↄhjegↄ        | plum                |
| ?               | tsegun          | tsegudↄ           | dog                 |
| alↄguk’ogↄ      | alↄguk’o        | ?                 | lemon               |
| ?               | k’apʰtʰↄ        | k’apʰtʰↄgↄ        | old man             |
| kʰↄdↄ           | kʰↄ             | ?                 | blanket             |
| k’ↄdↄ           | ?               | k’ↄdↄ             | tomato              |
| ?               | alↄ             | ?                 | apple               |
| ?               | pʰↄ             | ?                 | buffalo             |
| ?               | ?               | sadↄ              | child               |
| ↄlsun           | ?               | ?                 | comb                |
| ?               | pitso           | ?                 | fork                |
| ?               | tʰↄpʰpaa        | ?                 | chair               |

Fill in the cells with the question marks.

△! The Kiowa language belongs to the Kiowa-Tanoan family. It is an endangered language, only spoken by a few hundred people in Oklahoma, USA.
The Kiowa words are given in a simplified transcription. k’, t’, p’, kʰ, pʰ, tʰ are consonants; ↄ is a vowel. -Aleksejs Pegu2evs
